units.title: Tissue preparation and washing
units.text: on tissue was ﬁrst sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientiﬁc) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish ﬁlled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min between each wash.
units.rationale: Describes actionable steps for tissue processing and washing prior to organoid isolation.

units.title: Crypt isolation using EDTA and rotator
units.text: After the ﬁnal wash, tissue was resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 h.
units.rationale: Details the specific protocol for crypt release using EDTA and controlled incubation conditions.

units.title: Organoid seeding in microwell plates
units.text: Experiments involving microwell plates utilized 500 µm Gri3D plates (SUN bioscience). ... Organoids that had been maintained in Cultrex domes for at least 5 days after passaging were removed from the ECM following the passaging protocol as above, and washed with PBS and imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect ﬂuorescence and DIC images.
units.rationale: Describes the setup and handling of organoids in microwell plates, including washing and imaging steps.

units.title: Organoid culture media protocol
units.text: 50 µL of media per well. The plates were placed in the incubator for 30–60 min to allow the cells to settle, after which another 100 µL of media containing 2% Matrigel was added per well. It is critical that 10 µM Y-27632 was added. Media was changed every other day to organoid growth media.
units.rationale: Provides precise media addition, timing, and critical reagent instructions for organoid culture maintenance.

units.title: Organoid dissociation with enzyme mixes
units.text: Organoids in mix 1 were then placed at 10 °C for 10 min, after which enzyme mix 2 was added. Organoids were kept at 10 °C throughout dissociation for up to 60 min, and were removed every 10 min to be pipette mixed with a P1000.
units.rationale: Outlines the stepwise enzymatic dissociation protocol with temperature and timing controls.

units.title: Antibody staining and washing for organoids
units.text: Organoids were then resuspended in primary antibody diluted in organoid wash buffer (0.1% Triton X-100, 0.2% BSA (Miltenyi)) overnight at 4 °C on a rocker. On the following day, organoids were washed three times (2 h per wash at 4 °C on a rocker) in organoid wash buffer, and then resuspended in secondary antibody with DAPI diluted in organoid wash buffer. On the next day, organoids were washed three times with PBS (2 h per wash at 4 °C on a rocker), and then placed in a 96-well glass bottom plate.
units.rationale: Comprehensive protocol for primary and secondary antibody staining with precise washing intervals and conditions.

units.title: FFPE tissue processing and antigen retrieval
units.text: Formalin-ﬁxed, parafﬁn-embedded (FFPE) tissue blocks were sectioned at 5 µm thickness using a microtome and processed according to Nanostring’s protocol. Deparafﬁnization and antigen retrieval were performed using the Leica Bond RX system. Slides were incubated with ER1 (AR9961, Leica) at 100 °C for 20 min to retrieve antigens. Subsequently, proteinase K was added through the pipetting port. The plate was placed in the tissue culture incubator for at least 30 min.
units.rationale: Details the standardized FFPE processing, antigen retrieval, and enzyme treatment steps for spatial analysis.

units.title: Cell staining and filtration for single-cell sequencing
units.text: Organoids were resuspended in 100 µL cell staining buffer (2% BSA, 0.01% Tween in PBS) and then blocked with 5uL human TruStain FCX blocking buffer (BioLegend) for 10 min on ice. Organoids were then washed three times with cell staining buffer on ice. After the ﬁnal wash, organoids were resuspended in 0.04% BSA in PBS, ﬁltered through a 70 µm Flowmi cell strainer (Sigma Aldrich) and loaded onto a 10X Chromium X.
units.rationale: Describes the precise cell staining, blocking, washing, and filtration protocol prior to single-cell sequencing.

units.title: Organoid imaging and quantification
units.text: Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect ﬂuorescence and DIC images, and the percentage of intact organoids was calculated as the number of organoids per condition/donor that excluded FITC-dextran from the lumen divided by the total number of organoids. For apoptosis quantiﬁcation, organoids were imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect ﬂuorescence and DIC images. The % area of caspase was quantiﬁed using FIJI66 as the area of organoid stained positive for Caspase-3/7 divided by the total area of the organoid.
units.rationale: Provides exact imaging and quantitative analysis methods for organoid integrity and apoptosis.

units.title: Perturbation screen with recombinant proteins
units.text: Human recombinant proteins was added to each well (Supplementary Data 13). Media was changed every 1–2 days with fresh organoid media containing human recombinant proteins, and organoids were collected for scRNA-seq on day 8 post-seeding.
units.rationale: Describes the perturbation protocol involving recombinant protein exposure and timed collection for sequencing.
